title	geo_accession	status	submission_date	last_update_date	type	channel_count	source_name_ch1	organism_ch1	characteristics_ch1	characteristics_ch1.1	characteristics_ch1.2	characteristics_ch1.3	characteristics_ch1.4	characteristics_ch1.5	characteristics_ch1.6	characteristics_ch1.7	characteristics_ch1.8	characteristics_ch1.9	characteristics_ch1.10	characteristics_ch1.11	characteristics_ch1.12	molecule_ch1	extract_protocol_ch1	extract_protocol_ch1.1	taxid_ch1	data_processing	data_processing.1	data_processing.2	data_processing.3	platform_id	contact_name	contact_email	contact_phone	contact_institute	contact_address	contact_city	contact_zip/postal_code	contact_country	data_row_count	instrument_model	library_selection	library_source	library_strategy	relation	relation.1	relation.2	supplementary_file_1
Berry_London_Sample1	GSM2886035	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_London_Test_set_Active_TB	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Active_TB	outlier: No	patient_id: 10061										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_London.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_London.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484595	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165748	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465212	NONE

Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS). Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Berry_London_Sample9	GSM2886043	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_London_Test_set_Active_TB	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Active_TB	outlier: No	patient_id: 10062										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_London.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_London.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484596	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165793	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465220	NONE
Berry_London_Sample10	GSM2886044	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_London_Test_set_Active_TB	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Active_TB	outlier: No	patient_id: 10069										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_London.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_London.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484606	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165792	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465221	NONE

Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_London.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_London.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484635	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165754	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465229	NONE
Berry_London_Sample19	GSM2886053	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_London_Test_set_Control	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: 10113										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_London.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_London.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484597	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165789	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465238	NONE
Berry_London_Sample28	GSM2886062	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_London_Test_set_LTBI	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: 10071										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_London.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_London.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484611	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165773	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465247	NONE
Berry_London_Sample37	GSM2886071	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_London_Test_set_Active_TB	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Active_TB	outlier: No	patient_id: 10096										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_London.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_London.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484631	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165766	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465256	NONE
Berry_London_Sample46	GSM2886080	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_London_Test_set_Active_TB	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Active_TB	outlier: No	patient_id: 30004										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_London.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_London.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484617	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165755	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465265	NONE
Berry_SouthAfrica_Sample1	GSM2886089	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_SouthAfrica_Validation_set_LTBI	Homo sapiens	tissue: whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: 50002										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484504	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165738	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465272	NONE

Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484510	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165732	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465280	NONE
Berry_SouthAfrica_Sample11	GSM2886098	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_SouthAfrica_Validation_set_Active_TB	Homo sapiens	tissue: whole blood	group: Active_TB	outlier: No	patient_id: 40018										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484534	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165733	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465281	NONE

Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484520	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165718	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465289	NONE
Berry_SouthAfrica_Sample20	GSM2886107	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_SouthAfrica_Validation_set_LTBI	Homo sapiens	tissue: whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: 50039										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484521	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165720	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465290	NONE

Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484529	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165712	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465298	NONE
Berry_SouthAfrica_Sample29	GSM2886116	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_SouthAfrica_Validation_set_LTBI	Homo sapiens	tissue: whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: 50047										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484542	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165704	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465307	NONE
Berry_SouthAfrica_Sample39	GSM2886125	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_SouthAfrica_Validation_set_LTBI	Homo sapiens	tissue: whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: 50067										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484548	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165703	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465308	NONE

Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Berry_SouthAfrica.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	Reanalysis of: GSM484524	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165742	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465316	NONE
Berry_SouthAfrica_Sample50	GSM2886134	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Berry_SouthAfrica_Validation_set_Active_TB	Homo sapiens	tissue: whole blood	group: Active_TB	outlier: No	patient_id: 40014										total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample10	GSM2886142	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_Control_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_024	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2001	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 62	visit_date: 2015-10-20	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165685	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465507		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample18	GSM2886150	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_Control_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_033	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2013	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 39	visit_date: 2015-11-06	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165636	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465515		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample26	GSM2886158	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_LTBI_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_035	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Positive	ethnicity: Central_Asia_Afganistan	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 1999	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 41	visit_date: 2016-03-11	timepoint_months: 3.1-4.0	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165673	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465523		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample34	GSM2886166	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_Control_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_039	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Positive	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2008	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 23	visit_date: 2016-11-09	timepoint_months: 9.1-12.0	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165665	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465531		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample42	GSM2886174	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_Control_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_041	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Positive	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2014	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 65	visit_date: 2016-01-04	timepoint_months: 0.6-1.0	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165601	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465539		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample51	GSM2886182	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_Control_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_047	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2012	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 43	visit_date: 2015-11-19	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165587	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465547		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample61	GSM2886190	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_Control_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_070	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 1998	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 46	visit_date: 2016-01-13	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165579	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465555		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample69	GSM2886198	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_Control_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_081	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: East_African_Uganda	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 1972	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 51	visit_date: 2016-06-16	timepoint_months: 3.1-4.0	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.
