Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165571	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465563		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample80	GSM2886206	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_LTBI_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_096	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Positive	ethnicity: East_Africa_Tanzania	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2011	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 35	visit_date: 2016-06-16	timepoint_months: 2.1-3.0	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165596	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465571		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample92	GSM2886214	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_LTBI_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: Yes	patient_id: Patient_132	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2011	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 35	visit_date: 2016-04-07	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165658	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465579		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample100	GSM2886222	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_Control_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_134	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: British_Indian	birth_place: UK_Born	uk_arrival_year: NA	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 36	visit_date: 2016-08-17	timepoint_months: 3.1-4.0	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165650	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465587		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample110	GSM2886230	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_LTBI_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_166	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 1998	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 41	visit_date: 2016-11-02	timepoint_months: 3.1-4.0	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165642	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465595		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample118	GSM2886238	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_LTBI_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_178	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2016	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 25	visit_date: 2017-07-21	timepoint_months: 9.1-13.0	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165561	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465603		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample129	GSM2886246	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_LTBI_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: Yes	patient_id: Patient_196	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: East_African_Sudan	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2010	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 36	visit_date: 2016-08-11	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165629	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465611		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample137	GSM2886254	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_LTBI_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_199	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Positive	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2011	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 40	visit_date: 2017-02-03	timepoint_months: 4.1-5.0	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165621	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465619		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample150	GSM2886262	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_LTBI_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_237	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2000	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 55	visit_date: 2016-11-22	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.	Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165613	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465627		NONE
Leicester_non_progressor_longitudnal_only_Sample158	GSM2886270	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_LTBI_Non_progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_239	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 1996	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 65	visit_date: 2016-11-22	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genome_build: Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86)	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw_counts_Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal.xlsx: Raw counts generated from paired-end RNA-seq fastq files, aligned using HISAT2 and quantified using HtSeq	Supplementary_files_format_and_content: edgeR_normalized_Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal.xlsx: Log2 expression values generated from edgeR, filtered using counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts	GPL20301	Akul,,Singhania	akul.singhania@crick.ac.uk	+442037963319	The Francis Crick Institute	1 Midland Road	London	NW1 1AT	United Kingdom	0	Illumina HiSeq 4000	cDNA	transcriptomic	RNA-Seq	BioSample: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN08165459	SRA: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra?term=SRX3465322		NONE
Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample5	GSM2886278	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_LTBI_Progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI_Progressor	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_002	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Positive	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2013	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 23	visit_date: 2016-01-11	timepoint_months: 3.4-5.0_Active_TB_diagnosed	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample14	GSM2886286	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_LTBI	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_021	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2013	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 16	visit_date: 2015-10-16	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample22	GSM2886294	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_Control	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_033	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2013	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 39	visit_date: 2015-11-06	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample35	GSM2886302	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_Active_TB	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Active_TB	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_046	tb_disease_type: Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2012	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 37	visit_date: 2015-11-19	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample43	GSM2886310	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_Control	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_063	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: British_Indian	birth_place: UK_Born	uk_arrival_year: NA	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 17	visit_date: 2015-12-23	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample51	GSM2886318	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_Active_TB	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Active_TB	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_076	tb_disease_type: Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2011	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 30	visit_date: 2016-01-20	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample60	GSM2886326	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Longitudnal_Leicester_LTBI_Progressor	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI_Progressor	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_087	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2002	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 54	visit_date: 2016-05-20	timepoint_months: 2.6-3.3	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample68	GSM2886334	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_Active_TB	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Active_TB	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_099	tb_disease_type: Pulmonary	smear_result: Positive	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2005	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 40	visit_date: 2016-02-24	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample76	GSM2886342	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_Control	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_114	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Positive	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2004	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 48	visit_date: 2016-03-08	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample84	GSM2886350	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_LTBI	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_129	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2007	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 67	visit_date: 2016-03-30	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample92	GSM2886358	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_Active_TB	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Active_TB	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_137	tb_disease_type: Pulmonary	smear_result: Positive	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2016	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 38	visit_date: 2016-04-26	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample100	GSM2886366	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_Control	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_154	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2007	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 38	visit_date: 2016-06-09	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample108	GSM2886374	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_Control	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_163	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2011	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 26	visit_date: 2016-07-14	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample116	GSM2886382	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_LTBI	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_178	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2016	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 25	visit_date: 2016-07-12	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample124	GSM2886390	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_Control	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_187	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Positive	ethnicity: South_Asia_ISC	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 1986	gender: M	age_at_baseline_visit: 33	visit_date: 2016-07-26	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample132	GSM2886398	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_Control	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: Control	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_205	tb_disease_type: Contact_Non-Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: British_Indian	birth_place: UK_Born	uk_arrival_year: NA	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 19	visit_date: 2016-08-22	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts. Leicester_with_progressor_longitudinal_Sample140	GSM2886406	Public on Apr 19 2018	Dec 12 2017	Apr 19 2018	SRA	1	Leicester_LTBI	Homo sapiens	tissue: Whole blood	group: LTBI	outlier: No	patient_id: Patient_216	tb_disease_type: Contact_Pulmonary	smear_result: Negative	ethnicity: Central_Africa_Cameroon	birth_place: Foreign_Born	uk_arrival_year: 2009	gender: F	age_at_baseline_visit: 33	visit_date: 2016-09-16	timepoint_months: Baseline	total RNA	Total RNA was isolated from 1 ml whole blood using the MagMAX™ for Stabilized Blood Tubes RNA Isolation Kit (Applied Biosystems/Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Globin RNA was depleted from total RNA (1.5–2 µg) using the human GLOBINclear kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RNA yield of total and globin-reduced RNA was assessed using a NanoDrop™ 8000 spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). Quality and integrity of total and globin-reduced RNA were assessed with the HT RNA Assay reagent kit (Perkin Elmer) using a LabChip GX bioanalyser (Caliper Life Sciences/Perkin Elmer) and assigned an RNA Quality Score (RQS).	Samples (200 ng) with an RQS > 6 were used to prepare a cDNA library using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA HT Library Preparation Kit (Illumina). The tagged libraries were sized and quantitated in duplicate (Agilent TapeStation system), using D1000 ScreenTape and reagents (Agilent), normalised, pooled and then clustered using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 PE Cluster Kit (Illumina). The libraries were imaged and sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencer using the HiSeq® 3000/4000 SBS kit (Illumina) at a minimum of 25 million paired end reads (75 bp) per sample.	9606	Raw paired-end RNA-seq data obtained for Berry London, Berry South Africa and Leicester cohorts was processed separately and subjected to quality control using FastQC (Babraham Bioinformatics) and MultiQC. Trimmomatic v0.36 was used to remove adapters and filter raw reads below the 36 bases long and leading and trailing bases below quality 25. Filtered reads were aligned to the Homo sapiens genome Ensembl GRCh38 (release 86) using HISAT2 v2.0.4 with default settings and RF rna-strandedness including unpaired read reads resulting from Trimmomatic. Mapped and aligned reads were quantified to obtain gene-level counts using HtSeq v0.6.1 with default settings and reverse strandedness. Raw counts were processed using the bioconductor package edgeR v3.14.0 in R. Genes expressed with counts per million (CPM) >2 in at least 5 samples were considered and normalised using trimmed mean of M- values (TMM) to remove library-specific artefacts.
